item.title: 20220823172238-oneliners
item.description: also: some old poetry i wrote when I was young $~$ How was it possible for someone to breathe in air and breathe out poetry?

item.title: A haiku about Mondays
item.description: OR: some old poetry i wrote when I was young Monday is busy People walking fast the street To be productive

item.title: Cupcake and peas
item.description: also: some old poetry i wrote when I was young (i wrote this for an elementary paper pretending I was a first grade kid lol)

item.title: Dearest
item.description: Dearest, Do you, my beloved, have a slight inkling of how you remoulded this existence of mine many would call a life?

item.title: Meteorite
item.description: also: some old poetry i wrote when I was young $~$ Careless whispers surround the night Stars twinkle under the foggy twilight

item.title: The First Day - I Thought
item.description: also: some old poetry i wrote when I was young $~$ Time moves agonizingly slow No right words ought to follow

item.title: The Last Day - I Stopped
item.description: also: some old poetry i wrote when I was young $~$ It’s been too long since our goodbye It’s funny how it went, all reasons why

item.title: When Summer and Autumn Collided
item.description: also: some old poetry i wrote when I was young $~$ An eighteen-day gap on our twin-month birthday You were born Friday, I was on the last Tuesday
